results.title: Into the west
results.brief_description: Gabriel Burn stars as a widower and former gypsy king who has rejected his nomadic ancestry to settle with his two boys amid the grim tower blocks of Dublin. He is far from the perfect father, spending most of the time in the pub while his children tend to themselves. Their life is magically altered by the arrival of their grandfather with a magnificent white stallion called Tir na nOg, a figure out of Irish legend. The children, Ossie and Tito, take an instant shine to the horse, but events beyond their control occur when the horse is impounded by corrupt police officials. Ossie and Tito begin a desperate mission to regain the stallion that has brought happiness to their lives. This fantasy come Western is set against the magnificent Irish backdrop, and is as much a story about a father’s redemption as it is about searching for happiness and adventure. Cast includes Ellen Barkin, Ruaidhri Conroy and Ciaran Fitzgerald. Written by Jim Sheridan.

results.title: Into the straight
results.creator_credit: Embassy Pictures Corporation (US), McCreadie Bros and T.O. McCreadie
results.brief_description: A melodrama, partly shot on location at Scone, N.S.W., involving romance and intrigue against a background of the world of horse racing and culminating in the Melbourne Cup. The film follows the fortunes of a racehorse breeding family, the Curzons, who need to strengthen their blood stock to re establish a fading reputation. This results in the purchase of a champion English horse, along with a father and son training team. Rivalry develops between the men for the love of the Curzon daughter, and for the attentions of a femme fatale nightclub singer, Zara Marlowe. A mock race was staged at Flemington and Randwick for the film and famous jockeys of the time, Jack Purcell and George Moore make brief personal appearances. Cast includes Charles Tingwell, Muriel Steinbeck and Nonnie Peifer.

results.title: Into secondary school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Nuffield Foundation, John Arnold and John Fletcher
results.brief_description: Application of the Nuffield mathematics course for children during their first two years of secondary school. Pupils at the Grass Royal Secondary Modern school, Yeovil and the Elliott Comprehensive, Putney are seen on their projects and the physical problems of coping with 100 children in one class session are discussed.

results.title: Into everything: providing for toddlers in child care
results.creator_credit: Video Media Production and Alex Jaye
results.brief_description: Shows how the developmental stages of pre-kindergarten children can be positively influenced by the provision of appropriate adult support and facilities in child care. Aimed at chilcare providers with little or no knowledge of cognitive and emotional stages of child development. This video emphasises that safe, colourful, cheerful and organised programs of care best facilitate proper psychomotor development. Appropriate for Professional Development and Personal Development (Home Economics).

results.title: Into Darkest Borneo
results.brief_description: The Jungles of Borneo - one of those rare places where nature has reached her greatest complexity of design. This program follows an expedition that went in search of the Purnam, lonely wanderers in Borneo’s vast jungle. Unchanged for thousands of years, the forests are the home of this tribe, their future looking increasingly bleak due to jungle clearance and the spread of civilisation. The aim of the expedition was to study the Purnam and document their way of life before it is too late. Their search took them into the heart of darkest Borneo - a trek fraught with dangers and discomforts, their quest driving them deeper and deeper into the wilderness.

results.title: Into a wider world
results.creator_credit: Extension Branch of the Girl Guides of Victoria
results.brief_description: The Extension Branch of the Girl Guides Association of Victoria was established to provide the thrill of guiding to mentally and physically disabled girls. This documentary presents some of the people and activities associated with this service by following Ethel, a young woman crippled by poliomylitis, as she is admitted to the Othopaedic Section of the Children’s Hospital at Mt Eliza and joins a group of Guides that has been established there. Through her involvement in the programs and activities, Ethel improves sufficiently to earn an income. Also shows activities at Janefield.

results.title: Intirumi
results.creator_credit: Unesco, Government of Peru and Luis Lopez Alvarez
results.brief_description: This film reveals the origins of the Inca civilization through an exploration of what remains, and what has replaced it, in Peru today. The early history is traced through surveying old structures, and through old implements. Each of these facets reveals something of the level of thought of the Incas. Commentary: Andrew Faulds Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Intimations talks to Richard Lester
results.brief_description: Malcolm Muggeridge talks to American born film director Richard Lester about the experiences and influences that have affected his work and his decision to give up psychology for the cinema and the nature of filmmaking. His films include “Running, Jumping, Standing Still” nominated for an Academy Award and first prize at the San Francisco Film Festival; “The Knack” which won the Palm D’Or at Cannes; the Beatles films “A Hard Day’s Night” and “Help” which shared the Grand Prix in the Rio Festival. In addition he has written many songs and scripts and directed several hundred commercials. He also talks about the influence of his parents, and slapstick comedy and its appeal as a reaction to an ordered, mercantile society.

results.title: Intervista
results.creator_credit: Aljosha Productions, Fernlyn, Rai Cinecitta, Ibrahim Moussa and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: Elephants, fat women, spectacular sets - all the visual Fellini grotesquerie is found in this mesmerising evocation and celebration of Fellini’s past and the mammoth Cinecitta studios outside Rome. A Japanese TV crew arrives to make a film on Fellini at work on his new project in the studio that gave birth not just to Fellini’s ‘La Strada’ and ‘La Dolce vita’ but also to Hollywood epics ‘Ben Hur’ and ‘Cleopatra’. We are conducted on a backstage tour of familiar landmarks in Fellini’s career, culminating in a poignant reunion of the stars of ‘La Dolce vita’. Marcello Mastroianni, clad as a magician for a TV ad, visits Anita Ekberg in her hillside villa and tears are shed when they see their youthful selves. Not just a sentimental tour of Fellini mannerisms, this film suggests that the past can only be recaptured on film. Fellini himself emerges as a genial craftsman flourishing in the company of the travelling circus that swirls around him. With equal relish for the absurd and the colossal, Fellini asserts his love of life and the magical power of cinema.

results.title: Interviews with the builders of ACMI @ Federation Square
results.brief_description: There are two segments - the first with Philip Walsh walking down and back along the old platform 15, 16 during demolition and the second part (and the priority) is of Don Bates presenting the drawings to Nigel Milan from SBS
